docs.title: Pltsave. Super easy way to save and open matplotlib plots.
Install
docs.text:
See installation page for more information.

pip install pltsave

docs.title: Example
docs.text: This library is tested on different examples. See 1d example and 2d example to get idea what plots can be easily saved.

docs.title: Testing 1D plots
docs.text: This file contains some plots that was successfully saved with pltsave library.

docs.title: Start
docs.text: This file contains some plots that was successfully saved with pltsave library.

docs.title: Version 0.1.0. Fully Working Beta Version
docs.text:
Quickly:

  • The library is incredibly easy to use, with two main frontend methods: dumps and loads.
  • It has been tested with various types of plots. (Refer to the examples)
  • Brief documentation is available.

docs.title: How to use pltsave
docs.text: Make sure you have installed the package before.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Save a figure:

import pltsave

figure_info = pltsave.dumps(fig).to_json()

Load the figure

fig = pltsave.loads(figure_info)

docs.title: Installation pltsave
docs.text: You can install the pltsave library using either pip or by pulling the repository directly from GitHub.

docs.title: Option 1: Install via Pip
docs.text:
Open your terminal and run the following command

pip install pltsave

docs.title: Option 2: Install from GitHub
docs.text:
You can also install pltsave directly from its GitHub repository. This option is useful if you want to work with the latest development version or if you need to customize the library. Here's how to do it:

  1. Clone the pltsave repository from GitHub using the following command:
git clone https://github.com/kyrylo-gr/pltsave.git
  1. Enter the directory and install the package.
cd pltsave
pip install .

Instead pip install . you can run python setup.py develop if you prefer.

docs.title: That's it!
docs.text: You've successfully installed the pltsave library. And it's super easy to use. See how to use page for more details.
